how do i uninstall all wine apps easily: You could probably just delete the wine folder if you really wanted to
Well, if that's definitely what you want to do, I guess you could just do rm -rf /home/$USER/.wine/
if you really want to be sure to get everything you can put sudo in front of the command I gave
But be very careful, if you type it in wrong you could hose your whole system.
What happens when you do exactly this. Click Applications -> Accessories -> terminal, then type rm -rf /home/$USER/.wine/
If you don't want wine anymore, sudo apt-get purge wine
Nothing is good, that means it erased everything that was in your wine folder successfully. Now if you want to actually uninstall wine completely, you can do sudo apt-get purge wine
